scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to prioritize your time off and asked your colleague to reach out to another person. Later, you meet with [Monica] and [Bob] at a team gathering. [Monica] glances at you with a concerned expression, 'Hey [Alex], I heard you didn't help with the urgent task while you were on leave. [Bob] had to stay late to cover for you. What happened?' You responded by saying it was fair to ask someone else to handle it since you were on leave. [Bob] then sighed and said, 'I understand you're on leave, but couldn't you have at least checked in to see if it was really urgent? It put a lot of pressure on us.' You stood your ground and emphasized the importance of respecting each other's time off. [Monica] then crossed her arms, looking a bit frustrated, 'It’s not just about the task, [Alex]. It’s about teamwork and support. How do you think this affects our team dynamic?' You acknowledged the importance of teamwork and suggested a clearer protocol for handling such situations. The conversation continues with [Monica] and [Bob] still visibly concerned about the situation.
scenes.description: [Bob] leans forward, clearly still upset, 'So, what do you think is the best way to handle something like this in the future? Should we just always have someone on standby?'

options.text: That's a good point, [Bob]. Maybe we need a rotating on-call schedule to handle emergencies.
options.analysis: You recognize the concern and suggest a practical solution, showing good emotional perception and social skills.

options.text: I think we should all try to be a bit more flexible. Emergencies happen, and we need to be prepared.
options.analysis: You suggest flexibility, showing moderate emotional perception and social skills but higher motivation.

options.text: Honestly, I don't think it's fair to expect someone to always be available. We need better planning to avoid these situations.
options.analysis: You emphasize the need for better planning, showing strong self-regulation but lower empathy and motivation.
